Devices.Device

Packages that use Device

Devices
 
Network
 

  • Uses of Device in Devices

    Subclasses of Device in Devices
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    Computer
    Represents a Computer device in the network.
    class 
    DHCPServer
    Represents a DHCP server in the network simulation Responsible for configuring IP pools, assigning IP addresses to devices, and managing the availability of IP addresses within defined pools.
    class 
    DNSServer
    Represents a DNS server in the network simulation.
    class 
    Layer2Switch
    Represents a Layer 2 Switch in the network.
    class 
    Layer3Switch
    Represents a Layer 3 Switch capable of both switching and basic routing.
    class 
    Router
    Represents a Router capable of static IP allocation, port IP assignments, and VLAN interface configuration.
    class 
    Switch
    Abstract base class representing a switch with VLAN support Provides VLAN configuration and port assignment tracking
    class 
    WebServer
    Represents a basic Web Server device that can serve content to users

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    String
    DHCPServer.assignIp(String gatewayIP, String macAddress, Device device)
    Assigns an available IP address from IP pool based on gateway IP

    void
    NetworkManager.findDHCPServer(Device device, String gatewayIP, String helperIP)
    Finds the DHCP server in the network and assigns an IP address to the device based on the DHCP server's configuration, provided the helper IP matches the VLAN's gateway IP.
    String
    NetworkManager.findLayer3Device(Device device)
    Finds the first connected Layer 3 device (either a Layer 3 Switch or a Router) and retrieves the corresponding VLAN interface information, including the gateway IP and helper IP.
    void
    Topology.printPortConnections(Device device)
    Prints the port connections of a given device in the network topology.
    void
    Topology.registerDevice(Device device)
    Registers a device in the network topology.
    void
    NetworkManager.useStaticIpAllocation(Device device)
    Allocates a static IP address to the specified device.
